message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to show you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm confident you'll love. I'm willing to offer it to you for $15000. What do you think?
Thanks for the offer, Alice. That's a bit more than I was hoping to spend. Would you be willing to come down to $8000? I'm really interested in this product, but that's my top limit.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $8000 is your top limit, but I'm not willing to sell it to you at that price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $11000. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate you meeting me halfway, but $11000 is still a bit high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $9500. That's a significant step from my original offer, and it's the absolute maximum I can afford right now.
Bob, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm not willing to sell it to you for $9500. I'm willing to meet you at $10500, which is still a good deal for both of us. What do you think?
Alice, I'm really trying to make this work, but $10500 is still a bit out of my range.  If you can come down to $9800, I'm ready to buy. This is my final offer.
Bob, I understand that you're trying to make this work, but I'm not willing to sell it to you for $9800. I'm willing to meet you at $10200, which is still a good compromise. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $10200 is still too much for me.  I'm willing to go up to $9900. If you can't accept that, I'll have to seriously consider buying from John.
Bob, I understand that you're getting close to your limit, but I'm not willing to sell it to you for $9900. I'm willing to meet you at $10100, which is still a good compromise. What do you think?
